page.title: 18Mayday.Buildings. Council
page.content: Mayday Cont. Nowadays Mayday has to be on a school day so that the children can easily be gathered together. Their efforts are judged in the school and then paraded round the village. Silver cups are awarded in each section and all the children are rewarded with small amounts of money. Listed Buildings. There are four listed buildings, two farm houses, the old Baptist Chapel (now an old people's home) and Longwick Mill. It is hoped to make some flint buildings listed in the future. Parish Council. There are seven members of the Parish Council representing the five villages that make up the civil parish of Longwick-cum-Ilmer.
